content.rendered:
If humor is good medicine, don’t forget to take yours. Here are some jokes you might enjoy. Remember, be kind. I’m going to try to make these up on my own.

Judy: “You can’t sit here, this seat is saved.”
Frank: “Good, I’ve been praying for it.”

Judy: “Can you help me change this lightbulb?”
Frank: “Lord, we ask that You would help this bulb change.”

Judy: “Do you think God has a sense of humor?”
Frank: “He made me, didn’t he?”

Judy: “Have you seen the weather forecast?”
Frank: “It’s going to be rainy HOT.”
Judy: “Rainy HOT?”
Frank: “Yes, it’s going to be raining here or there.”

Frank: “Did you hear about the dog that walked twelve miles to visit his Pa and Grandpa?”
Judy: “No, tell me more.”
Frank: “When he got there, his Pas were tired.”

Judy: “How did your trip to Germany go?”
Frank: “It went well. But one day, I was out and I heard music playing; it seemed to be playing backwards.”
Judy: “Backwards?”
Frank: “Yes, so I followed it.”
Judy: “Where did it lead?”
Frank: “It led me to a cemetery, where I found the ghost of Beethoven.”
Judy: “What did he say.”
Frank: “Don’t bother me, I’m decomposing.”

Frank: “Knock-knock.”
Judy: “Who’s there?”
Frank: “Bacon.”
Judy: “Bacon, who?”
Frank: “Seriously, Judy, bacon is no joke.”

I hope at least one of these made you smile. If you have your own jokes — remember to keep them clean — please comment below and have a great weekend.
